item.title: Kevin add a quote by Philo
item.description: "Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a great battle." -- Philo

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Things are in the saddle. And ride mankind." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Those who can make you believe absurdities, can make you commit atrocities." -- Voltaire

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Jean Anouilh
item.description: "Nobody has a more sacred obligation to obey the law than those who make the law." -- Jean Anouilh

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Pindar
Kevin add a quote by Thomas Hardy
item.description: "Though a good deal is too strange to be believed, nothing is too strange to have happened." -- Thomas Hardy

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Jean Renoir
item.description: "The truly terrible thing is that everybody has their reasons." -- Jean Renoir

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "I am fond of pigs. Dogs look up to us. Cats look down on us. Pigs treat us as equals." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "My dear friend, clear your mind of cant [excessive thought]. You may <i>talk</i> as other people do: you may say to a man, "Sir, I am your most humble servant." You are not his most humble servant. You may say, "These are bad times; it is a melancholy thing to be reserved to such times." You don't mind the times ... You may <i>talk</i> in this manner; it is a mode of talking in Society; but don't <i>think</i> foolishly." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kevin add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "Every normal man must be tempted, at times, to spit on his hands, hoist the black flag, and begin slitting throats." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Michael Ventura
item.description: "Be careful how you choose your enemy, for you will come to resemble him. The moment you adapt your enemy's methods your enemy has won. The rest is suffering and historical opera. " -- Michael Ventura

item.title: Kevin add a quote by thomas paine
item.description: "Independence is my happiness, and I view things as they are, without regard to place or person; my country is the world, and my religion is to do good." -- thomas paine
